name: market for paper, newsprint | paper, newsprint | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5451/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'paper, newsprint', in the geography of Europe.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;The product â€œpaper, newsprint", is a type of graphic paper. The product represents a mix of newsprint produced from virgin material and newsprint paper produced from wastepaper, including some deinked pulp (DIP). In the ecoinvent database, newsprint paper production is modelled for the production at integrated paper mills. Newsprint paper is used for printing newspapers. 

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'paper, newsprint',  within the geography of Europe.

This activity ends with the supply of 'paper, newsprint',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/17:Manufacture of paper and paper products/170:Manufacture of paper and paper products/1701:Manufacture of pulp, paper and paperboard

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Deliveries within/to Switzerland according to official Swiss trade statistics with country-specific transport distances.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Standard distances for domestic production, imports from CEPI countries and imports from outside. Estimated distribution of DIP-containing and 0%-DIP newsprint based on country-specific production information (CEPI statistics).
